reviews.review_msg: Lectures are simple slides. 90% of the grade was split amongst 5 different quizzes and the extra 10% was basically a participation mark for the discussions. It is possible to do entire quizzes to a satisfactory level by Ctrl+F'ing the lecture slides while doing the quiz without looking at them beforehand. Excellent GPA booster/stabilizer.

Amazing prof! Took 2 courses with him and actually enjoyed both. GPA booster on God - but only if you actually study a bit and don't just ChatGPT your way through. Content was super interesting, and grading is straightforward: 5 quizzes, 20% each. Just put in some effort, and you're golden. Highly recommend!

The online class content is very organized and understandable. I took another online class with him, and it was so good that I took it! Lectures are pretty engaging he has a nice voice and tone to his teaching.
The marking is mainly just from online quizzes/ tests and the courseload is pretty light.

ARCH226 is an interesting online class with a fair grading system. While the lectures can be lengthy, they are well-structured. To succeed, take notes, use unstuckstudy for study prep, and stay engaged. Workload is manageable with some effort.

This class is so amazing! Its got super interesting course content, recorded lectures can be a bit tedious to get through. If you set aside an hour or two a week, you can get through the course easily. Graded 90% on module quizzes, 10% on discussion posts. Honestly pretty easy quizzes if you actually understand the lectures. Would recommend!

The marking for this class was relatively fair and post midterm topics were interesting. However, if you are looking for a class with little weekly work, this might not be the class for you. Weekly lectures could range upwards of 7 different videos, and each video was between 20-40 minutes. Need to put in work to do well for sure. Prof was nice
The class is not worth taking at all, in fact, avoid taking any classes with this professor.

A great professor.. for in person classes. It's hours of videos that are just him reading directly off slides that have a massive chunk of text on them that look like they were pasted in from a textbook. The content is very interesting sometimes and dreadfully boring at others. Assignments/exams are very manageable, but lectures are not.

This has been my favourite class in university so far. The lecture videos (online class) were clear, well written, and entertaining. Arch226 is such an interesting course and I would recommend it to anyone interested in archaeology. It felt more like pursuing a hobby more than a class, 10/10

A lot of people say they don't like Dr. Maxwell but I disagree! HIs class is so easy. Lots of lecture watching but if you write notes (literally just copy paste the slides), you'll be fine. "Mandatory" readings too but they don't matter, it's just extra understanding. The midterms are directly based on lectures. Do the bare minimum and you'll pass.

I have taken classes with him in the past and always have had a good experience, this class was no different. Lots of lectures, but they are broken up to be more manageable. 2 exams and 3 assignments. Graded fairly.

Maxwell is a very understanding professor. He has cultivated his online classes to be exactly what they need to be in order for their students to succeed. He is a fairly straightforward professor and gives everything you need in order to achieve a good grade. Participation does matter but it is as simple as can be!
A very manageable course, graded by 2 assignments and 5 discussions as well as a midterm and final(which were extremely fair and open book) a gpa booster.

Very kind Prof, and the TA's were all helpful and fair markers. As long as you keep up with the readings and assignments you'll be fine. Overall this class is a solid choice, would 100% take another class with him.
Not much to say. He's very funny and interesting to listen to. His exams are very fair. In fact, all the answers can be found directly from his lectures. Overall, one of my favourite profs.

I am a phil major in my 4th year, never taken an Arch course before. I took this course for my WQB requirements, it was honestly the best choice ever. about 4-5 hours of lectures each week (if taking notes) and barely any readings, can do in one sitting. Got 100 on every assignment (took 2 hrs max each) and 93% of midterm. Midterm long answer q's.

Dr. Maxwell's class was fantastic. Although we do not every meet with/email him for help or concerns (everything is through TA), you can tell he outlined this class so that we would not even need help. Very carefully thought out modules with every possible resource you could need to do well. All you have to do is watch lectures no readings!!

Absolutely engaging, knowledgeable, never a dry moment. I could listen to him talk for hours on end. He is also super caring of his students, cancelling classes early due to expected snow, and making everything available online for students with reservations about showing up due to covid. If he is offering a course, take it!

Dr. Maxwell was a great professor! the assignments are marked fairly and the midterm and final were fair (just make sure to listen to the recorded lectures). Very interesting course with fair grading criteria. I highly recommend it!

Extremely kind prof. He was willing to give me an extension when I couldn't access an assignment because of technical problems. His lectures are interesting and a perfect pace. Would definitely recommend his class
Amazing guy, love him. Graded on assignments, discussion, a midterm and final. All were very fair in difficulty and assessment.

Bloody hilarious. Also looked forward to Dr. Maxwell's lectures. Engaging (even on dry topics), knows how to explain things so idiots like me get it, and breaks down complicated information well so it's not overwhelming. For tests, you need to understand the overarching concepts and be able to illustrate larger points with examples. Solid class!
He's very helpful and passionate about the course material. Slides tend to be overwhelming because they're filled with small details, but if you attend lectures he explains everything well.

I personally found this class with Maxwell pretty easy and laid back. However, if you don't find this topic interesting at all it will be super difficult to study for his midterm because it's ALL short answer format and 1 essay question. Overall he seems like a good guy and somewhat interested in the topic he's teaching.

Took the online course, fairly simple material. The discussions were easy marks and the assignments (3 of them) were also easy, but required a little bit of effort if looking for full marks. The exams were actually very detailed asking questions that required memorization of many facts/details/terms.

Online course (summer session), so not much interaction with Brea herself, but she comes across as very kind & approachable. Content was super interesting, simple weekly discussions, but the quiz questions were irritating. Huge chunks of "important" content wouldn't even appear, in favour of briefly mentioned details. Hard to prepare for.

This course was fun. its very organized and the prof provides lots of material for each concept. The midterm and final were generally simple! I suggest keeping up with the material weekly and while watching the slide videos doing the study questions for active learning. Brea is very easily accessible and answers email on time! highly recommend.

honestly an easy course if you focus on the tests and assignments, lectures are a lot of info I personally stopped watching after the midterm but make sure for the md and final you write as much as you possibly can, in extreme detail, relating questions to other topics and INCLUDE EXAMPLES if you do that then you will get a good grade!!!

Take this class with David Maxwell. The discussions and assignments were easy and were graded properly, but she took major marks off for the midterm and final and gave no explanation as to why she thought that answer was wrong, even though all the answers came directly from her lecture slides. Class is super easy but don't take it with this lady.

GPA booster. Interesting and Brea was kind and accommodating. The course consisted of pre-recorded lectures, short weekly readings, discussions, two short papers, midterm and final. All was easy and light workload even for intercession. 3 hr online exams were 6 short answer questions and were open-book and not invigilated. Overall great course.

He's rather impersonal/unapproachable and teaching looks like a chore for him. The course may seem easy, but he expects a lot for the mt. You're expected to write down EVERYTHING in extreme detail to get a good mark. He wrote the damn textbook so if one little thing is missing, he'll know. Class average for the mt was extremely low.
Great straightforward prof. Easy to learn from. Does seem a bit remote. I never had to approach him for help etc.Loved the subject and his new way of looking at archaeology.Recommend this class.

I took another class with Brian several semesters ago, and decided to take this because I enjoyed the last class so much. Needless to say, it was exactly what I expected. Always interesting, the topics were well organized, and Brian is incredibly well informed. Make sure you read the textbook thoroughly, but don't stress over small details.

Brian is a chill guy who brings in lots of props and visual aids- I liked this a lot. Answered all questions in class very well. Has good logic and reasoning, but sometimes you can get lost in what he is talking about.  His sentences are too long and a little indirect. He has a certain mystique about him. Clearly is a fresh thinker.

It's been said Dr. Hayden's a "hard marker". That's an artifact of students not fully understanding the new way of thinking he advocates: actually think and don't regurgitate a textbook! Wonderful prof: really gets into his lectures and makes them interesting. I never wanted to skip class.
